newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says 1997 Q1 current account deficit 3.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru says 1997 Q1 current account deficit 3.9 pct.

text.p: Peru's Central Bank said Friday that the first quarter current account deficit was 3.9 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) versus 4.8 percent in the same period of last year.
The bank added that domestic savings had risen in the same period to the equivalent of 21.2 percent of GDP, from 19.1 percent in the first quarter of 1996.

"The improvement in the domestic savings is based on better tax collection that rose from 12.4 percent to 13.4 percent of GDP in the first quarter of 1996 and 1997 respectively," the bank said in a statement.
"The results of state companies, whose primary surplus increased from 0.1 percent to 0.8 percent of GDP, also helped," the statement added.
Total investment rose to 25.1 percent of GDP in the first quarter, from 23.9 percent in the same period last year.
